main

Class Navigator

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.Navigator

  • public class Navigator
extends java.lang.Object
    All the movements of the robot are controlled by this class. Obstacle avoidance method is also implemented in this class since it is used while the robot is moving towards its destination. In addition, this class includes the information and relevant calculations of the launching coordinates and navigation of the robot to those coordinates. Then it calls the launcher object to fire at the targets.
    Author:
    Niloofar Khoshsiyar

      • pMove

        protected void pMove(int orientation,
                     int difference)
        Moves the robot based on p-controller. The speed of movement depends on the distance from the wall or obstacle it is following.
        Parameters:
        orientation - to which the robot should move
        difference - of the robot's distance to the wall/obstacle from the band center

      • fireAt

        public void fireAt(double x,
                   double y,
                   double xMin,
                   double xMax,
                   double yMin,
                   double yMax,
                   int numBalls)
        Moves the robot to the point that it has to launch the ball. It stops and turns to the target. Then calls the launcher to launch a ball. All the input arguments of this class are in centimeters.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the launching point
        y - the y coordinate of the launching point
        xMin - the minimum possible x in the allowed launching zone
        xMax - the maximum possible x in the allowed launching zone
        yMin - the minimum possible y in the allowed launching zone
        yMax - the maximum possible y in the allowed launching zone
        numBalls - Number of ping pong balls to shoot

      • fireAtTiles

        public void fireAtTiles(double x,
                        double y,
                        double xMin,
                        double xMax,
                        double yMin,
                        double yMax,
                        int numBalls)
        Moves the robot to the point that it has to launch the ball. It stops and turns to the target. Then calls the launcher to launch a ball. All the input arguments of this class are in tiles
        Parameters:
        x - of the target
        y - of the target
        xMin - of firing zone
        xMax - of firing zone
        yMin - of firing zone
        yMax - of firing zone
        numBalls - Number of ping pong balls to shoot

      • convertHeadingToWheelAngle

        public static double convertHeadingToWheelAngle(double radius,
                                                double wheelDistance,
                                                double angle)
        Converts angle that the robot should turn into the angle that the wheels have to turn in degrees.
        Parameters:
        radius - of the wheel
        wheelDistance - distance of the two wheels of the robot
        angle - that we want the robot to change its heading to
        Returns:
        the angle that wheels should turn
